qas.question: How many internal ferry services does Southampton serve?
What is the name of the quay where all three ferries have their terminals?
How many of the ferries connect to the Isle of Wight?
What company operates the ferries to East Cowes and Cowes?
What body of water does the Hythe Ferry cross to reach Hythe from Southampton?

context: While Southampton is no longer the base for any cross-channel ferries, it is the terminus for <a0_0>three<a0_0/> internal ferry services, all of which operate from terminals at <a1_0>Town Quay<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Two<a2_0/> of these, a car ferry service and a fast catamaran passenger ferry service, provide links to East Cowes and Cowes respectively on the Isle of Wight and are operated by <a3_0>Red Funnel<a3_0/>. The third ferry is the Hythe Ferry, providing a passenger service to Hythe on the other side of <a4_0>Southampton Water<a4_0/>.
